English (United States)(en-US): A fruit fly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날파리다.

English (United States)(en-US): Hello, fruit fly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안녕, 날파리.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re different today. Swaying silently. I’m\nglad for the opportunity to scrutinize you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오늘은 색다르구나. 잠잠히 흔들리고 있네.\n모처럼 너를 낱낱이 뜯어볼 수 있어 기뻐.

English (United States)(en-US): I struggled to catch up with\nyou, swift and vibrant in the air.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 늘 빠르고 생기 있게 날아다니는 너의\n뒤꽁무니만 간신히 좇아야 했거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm? What’s that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어? 뭐라고 했어?

English (United States)(en-US): Oh? I guess I misheard. Well….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음? 아닌가. 어….

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>! I didn’t notice you there.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>! 어느새 와 있었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Do fruit flies normally not talk, <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날파리는 원래 말을 못 해, <nickname>?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, not with humans. We speak different\nlanguages, or maybe their voices are too… huh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 글쎄, 인간과는 소통이 안 되지. 언어가\n통하지 않거나, 목소리가 너무 작…… 어라.

English (United States)(en-US): Huh……?
(It’s dead.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (저 친구는 죽어 있는 거잖아.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Tell Dot the truth, that it’s a body.)|(Break it to Dot gently, lest Dot’ll be hurt.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (날파리의 시체라고 솔직하게 전하자.)|(더는 상처받지 않도록 부드럽게 돌려 말하자.)

English (United States)(en-US): Well… I think it’s dead.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어… 말을 못 하는 게 아니라. 죽은 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): They may be nonverbal… but I think this one’s\ngone to live with some nice people on a farm upstate.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날파리가 말을 못 하는 것일 수도 있지만…\n무지개 다리를 건넌 것 같기도 해.

English (United States)(en-US): A farm?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무지개 다리?

English (United States)(en-US): It’s a happy place where dogs, cats, and fruit\nflies go to once their time is over on Earth.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 강아지, 고양이, 그리고 날파리들이 지구에서의\n시간이 끝나면 가는 구름 위 동네야.

English (United States)(en-US): I know that. It’s a metaphor for death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 알아. 그거 ‘죽음’에 대한 은유잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Why would you metaphorize death to me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜 나에게 죽음을 은유해?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you think the fruit fly is dead?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날파리가 죽은 것 같아?

English (United States)(en-US): … Naaah.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 에이이.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, you’re teasing me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 정말 짖궂다.

English (United States)(en-US): He can hear you, you know?\nHe might get offended.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 얘가 듣고 있잖아? 상처받으면 어떡해.

English (United States)(en-US): He may be small but has a firm\nplace in the corner of this universe
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 작은 몸이지만 세상의 한\n공간을 분명하게 차지한 채

English (United States)(en-US): and sways with such spirit,\nleaving a vivid trace in its path.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이다지도 활력 있게 흔들리고\n있는데. 분명한 궤적을 그으며.

English (United States)(en-US): How can you joke about something like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어떻게 그런 농담을 할 수 있어?

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>. Say something.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>. 무슨 말이라도 해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): (Keep your silence..)|But I’m really not joking, Dot…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (침묵을 지킨다.)|농담이 아닌걸, 뭉치야….

English (United States)(en-US): The fruit fly is swaying… because the spider\nweb tied to him is swaying in the wind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 날파리가 흔들리는 건… 단지 그를 묶은\n거미줄이 바람에 흔들리고 있어서 그럴 뿐이야.

English (United States)(en-US): You mean he’s truly dead?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말 죽었다는 말을 하고 싶은 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): You don’t mean to say, <nickname>, that death\nis coiled around me like a black snake,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금 너는, <nickname>, 도처에 깔린 죽음이\n검은 뱀처럼 나를 휘감고 있으며

English (United States)(en-US): and like with the girl that fell at the party,\nthe mold, and this bug of all beings,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그날 파티에서 추락해 버렸던 그 인간부터,\n곰팡이, 헛웃음 나오지만 기어코 이 날벌레까지

English (United States)(en-US): it’s closing in on all quarters and\nclutching me tight like a prophecy,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 죽음들이 복선처럼 내 몸뚱아리를\n옥죄어 오고 있다는 말을 하고 싶은 건

English (United States)(en-US): right? You don’t mean that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이지 결코 아닐 거잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): Right? <nickname>?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? <nickname>?

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot has gone through\na lot of shock just now.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치는 지금 아까부터 이어지는\n강한 충격을 감당하고 있어.)
(그러니……)

English (United States)(en-US): (You pat Dot silently. You\ncan’t think of anything to say.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (말없이 뭉치를 쓰다듬는다.\n다른 위로가 떠오르지 않아.)

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, why must you worry\nme with your warm touch?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 왜 불안하게 날 이렇게\n다정한 손으로 쓰다듬어 주는 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): You’re comforting me. Why\nare you comforting me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이건 위로 같은 손길이잖아.\n나를 왜 위로해?

English (United States)(en-US): Why?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜?

English (United States)(en-US): You’re lying.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거짓말.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아.

English (United States)(en-US): But you’re not.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 리가 없지.

English (United States)(en-US): You wouldn’t lie, would you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 거짓말일 리가 없잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): You’ve always been brutally honest with me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너는 늘 나에겐 잔인할\n만큼 진실된 인간이니까.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s just that all feeble life dies in vain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 연약한 생명은 단지\n허무하게 죽어 버릴 뿐이고.

English (United States)(en-US): Like a dream that loses its warmth for\ngood and scatters once morning comes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아침이 오면 영영 차갑게\n식어 흩어지는 꿈처럼?

English (United States)(en-US): Beautiful but futile. And thus ugly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름답지만 허무한. 그렇기에 추한.

English (United States)(en-US): So.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니.

English (United States)(en-US): So he is dead.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 얘는 죽은 게 맞아.

English (United States)(en-US): I’m sorry, Dot. I know it isn’t easy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미안해, 뭉치. 받아들이기 쉽지 않을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): No one is ready to say goodbye.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 누구도 이별에 준비된 자는 없을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s alright, <nickname>. My human friend.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 괜찮아, <nickname>. 나의 인간 친구.

English (United States)(en-US): Just because all humans,\nall mold, and all insects die
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 모든 인간이, 모든 곰팡이가, 모든\n날벌레가 죽어 버린다고 해서

English (United States)(en-US): doesn’t mean I’ll die too, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 역시 죽는다는 보장은 없는 거잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): So it’s alright. But I’d like to be alone.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니 괜찮아. 나, 잠시 혼자 있을게.

English (United States)(en-US): I’ll be better after thinking things\nthrough. Please don’t mind me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭐라고 생각하고 있으면 조금\n나아질 거야. 신경 쓰지 말아 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): “We had nothing to lose but everything to gain.\nThose were the days we dared to dream.”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “가진 건 없었지만 잃을 것도 없던 날들이었다.\n감히 낭만이라 이름 붙이던 날들.”

English (United States)(en-US): The people on TV screamed this out\nloud… with their arms wide open.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 티비에서 이런 나레이션과 함께\n자유롭게 팔 벌리는 사람들을 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Nothing to lose. Everything to gain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가진 것이 없다. 잃을 것이 없다.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>.

English (United States)(en-US): What do you dare dream of?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>의 낭만은 뭐야?

English (United States)(en-US): To have nothing and lose nothing,\nsprinting through life barefoot?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 가진 것이 없기에 잃을 걱정도 없이,\n맨발로 부랑하며 내달리는 삶이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Or to tread lightly and keep what\nyou love in your arms safe and sound?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아니면 소중한 것들을 손아귀에\n그러쥐고 까치발 내디디는 삶이야?

English (United States)(en-US): Sprinting.|Treading.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내달리는 삶.|내디디는 삶.

English (United States)(en-US): Even though you could careen\noff a cliff, or smash into a wall?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 벼랑 너머로 추락하거나, 벽에\n추돌해 박살 날 수 있는데도?

English (United States)(en-US): (Sounds scary.)|(Even so.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (그건 무섭다.)|(그럼에도 달린다.)

English (United States)(en-US): Not quite what I imagined….\nI guess I could slow down.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇게 들으니까 섬뜩하네….\n속도는 늦춰야겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): I can see you sprinting (/arms wide open).
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 온건한 내달림을 상상해 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): Even so. Freedom is irreplaceable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그럼에도. 자유는\n무엇과도 바꿀 수 없으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): I can see you sprinting (/arms wide open).
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 대담한 내달림을 상상해 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): And if they slip from your grip?\nAnd shatter into a thousand pieces?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러다 미끄러져서 놓치게 되면?\n돌이킬 수도 없이 산산조각 나 버리면?

English (United States)(en-US): (Don’t sweat the small things.)|(I’m starting to get scared.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (괜한 걱정은 하지 않는다.)|(두려워지기 시작했다.)

English (United States)(en-US): 2 That won’t happen. I never\nlet go of what I hold dear.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럴 일은 없어. 난 소중한 걸 절대 놓치지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): I can see you treading firmly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 강인한 내디딤을 상상해 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): 2 Then I’ll only carry what\nI can. I’m bad at letting go.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 감당할 수 있을 만큼만\n쥐어야지. 잃는 건 무서워.

English (United States)(en-US): I can see you treading softly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 섬세한 내디딤을 상상해 봤어.

English (United States)(en-US): You’re smiling.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 웃고 있네.

English (United States)(en-US): The meteor collided on an ordinary day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 운석은 평범한 어떤 날에 충돌했어.

English (United States)(en-US): And this is just another story of one dinosaur.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 이건 어느 공룡 선생의\n특별할 것 없는 이야기.

English (United States)(en-US): He was out hunting, while\nhis partner was taking a nap.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 사냥 중이었고, 그의\n반려는 낮잠을 자고 있었지.

English (United States)(en-US): His grandfather, born so long ago,\nwas about to draw his last breath.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오래 전 태어난 그의 할아버지는 안\n그래도 생을 마감하기 직전이었고,

English (United States)(en-US): And his daughter was thrumming with life,\nready to break out of her egg into the world.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그의 딸은 태동하는 잠재력을 품은\n채 알을 깨고 나오려고 하고 있었어.

English (United States)(en-US): But the thing is, none of them saw it coming.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다만 중요한 건, 그 누구도\n예상하지 못했다는 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Longings for the future and regrets of the\npast spawned into thousands of colors,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 미래에 대한 미련과 과거에 대한\n후회가 수천 빛깔로 산란되다,

English (United States)(en-US): a thunderous roar. And not long\nafter the dinosaur’s vision turned red,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 굉음. 머지않아 물들듯\n붉어지던 공룡 선생의 시야.

English (United States)(en-US): all went the dark with a spark of pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 작열하는 찰나의 고통과\n함께 모든 게 암전되었어.

English (United States)(en-US): It sounds terrible.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말로만 들어도 끔찍한걸.

English (United States)(en-US): (Dot… What caused them to think on\nthe death of dinosaurs. I feel bad.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (뭉치… 어떤 마음으로 공룡의\n멸종을 떠올린 걸까. 안타까워져.)

English (United States)(en-US): The dinosaur looked at its crumbling\nbody and at first could not believe it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 공룡 선생은 모래처럼 타오른 몸을\n내려다보며, 처음에는 믿을 수 없다고 생각했어.

English (United States)(en-US): But he couldn’t roar, and he couldn’t weep,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 포효할 수도,\n눈물을 흘릴 수도 없었지.

English (United States)(en-US): Death had already swallowed\nhim and everything he knew.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음이 이미 그와, 그가 알던 모오든\n것들을 집어 삼킨 후였으니까….

English (United States)(en-US): He must have felt empty.|He must have seethed with rage.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 허망했을 것 같아.|분노로 들끓었을 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): Death, extinction… a chance at life,\nan entire species was eradicated.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음으로, 멸종으로… 한 생명의, 한\n종족의 가능성이 사실상 전멸했잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, the unfairness of it all must\nhave made him shout out.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 그는 부조리에 사무쳐\n이렇게 외쳤을 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): ”Here one moment and gone the next!”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “한 순간 있다가 다음 순간 없다니!”

English (United States)(en-US): “To have my beautiful life chained\nto an unavoidable tragedy,”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “나의 아름다운 생이 피할 수\n없는 비극의 일부로 귀속되어,”

English (United States)(en-US): “and dragged away before\nI can do anything about it!”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “어찌해 볼 도리 없이\n끌려 들어가야만 한다니!”

English (United States)(en-US): But……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만……

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, is the story not over?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 오, 이야기가 끝난 게 아니구나?

English (United States)(en-US): Of course, it never is. His story continues\nlong after his death, doesn’t it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼. 끝나지 않지. 죽음 이후에도\n공룡 선생의 이야기는 계속된걸?

English (United States)(en-US): He remains. He. Remains.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 남겨졌잖아. 그는. 남겨. 졌잖아.

English (United States)(en-US): After eons and eons past,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 영겁에 또 영겁의 시간이 지난 지금,

English (United States)(en-US): he now remains as a T-Rex’s skull\nin some museum, doesn’t he?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그는 어느 박물관의 티라노사우르스\n두개골로서 단단히 남아 있잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): “It is better than disappearing for good.\nTo remain as a fossil, in any shape,”
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “아예 사라지는 것보단 이게 나아.\n화석으로나마, 어떤 형태로나마”

English (United States)(en-US): “makes me somewhat happy,”\nI’m sure he would say.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): “세상에 머무를 수 있어서 조금은 기쁘구나.”\n그는 분명 이렇게 말할 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): To remain on Earth and be\nsomeone’s magical discovery,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이렇게라도 땅 위에 남아서\n누군가에게는 신비로운 발견이 되고,

English (United States)(en-US): or someone’s lifelong work to track down,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가에게는 인생의 연구로\n추적해야 할 흔적이 되고,

English (United States)(en-US): or someone’s important memory\nfrom a day at the museum.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 누군가에게는 어릴 적 박물관에서\n본 소중한 기억이 된다는 점.

English (United States)(en-US): To depart and yet remain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 떠났지만 남았다는 점.

English (United States)(en-US): To be safe from total extinction.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 완전한 소멸로부터 안전하다는 점.

English (United States)(en-US): …… For, ever.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): …… 영원, 히.

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, this inspiring story\nled me to a discovery.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 이 감명 깊은 이야기를\n듣고, 난 찾아 내고야 말았지.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes? What of?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 뭐를?

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, I have found a way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래, 나는 방법을 찾은 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): I should too. I should remain\nas a solid dream-fossil
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나 역시. 고체형의 꿈-화석으로 남아

English (United States)(en-US): and be your friend for a long\nlong long long time, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너와 오래 오래 오래 오래,\n친구 하면 되는 거잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): Right? I won’t have to disappear?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 사라지지 않을 수 있는 거잖아?

English (United States)(en-US): What if, what if? If I were a hideous\nblack ugly Dot-the-fossil
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹은, 혹은? 아주 혐오스럽겠지만서도 영문\n모를 이유로 너만은 그런 대로 예뻐해 줄

English (United States)(en-US): and yet you inexplicably loved me\nthe way I am, it would be alright.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 시커멓고 볼품없는\n뭉치-화석일지라도 괜찮으니까.

English (United States)(en-US): Right? What if I start researching ways\ntoday? I think I could make it work.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응? 내가 이제부터 연구해 보면\n될 것 같은데? 정말 될 것만 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): We already have a great precedent. Right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 멋진 선례가 있잖아. 맞지, 그렇지?

English (United States)(en-US): Yeah, Dot. I’ll be rooting for you.|Well, I’ve never heard of dream fossils.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 뭉치야. 응원하고 있을게.|글쎄, 꿈 화석은 들어 본 적이 없지만.

English (United States)(en-US): (It may be possible. Dot is a creature far\nbeyond what humans can understand.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (정말 가능할지도 몰라. 뭉치는 인간의\n상식으로 해석할 수 없는 괴물이니까.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Just maybe…)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어쩌면……)

English (United States)(en-US): (Is it possible? Even if Dot is a Moon creature\nfar beyond what humans can understand.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (가능할까? 아무리 뭉치가 인간의\n상식을 벗어난 달의 괴물이라지만….)

English (United States)(en-US): (But just maybe…)
Dot-the-fossil…. I’ll be rooting for you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치-화석이라…. 응원하고 있을게.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, thank you! <nickname>!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 고마워! <nickname>!

English (United States)(en-US): Wow….
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우와….

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, there’s going to\nbe a meteor shower soon.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 곧 별똥별이 내린대.

English (United States)(en-US): Hundreds of stars falling from the sky.
I wonder where they all came from?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 수많은 별들은 어디서 왔을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Did they travel all the way from a galaxy \nhundreds of millions of light-years away?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 몇 억 광년이 지나야 닿을 수 있는 은하수에서,\n멀고 먼 길을 건너 왔을까?

English (United States)(en-US): Or are they newborn stars born\nfrom a nearby planet?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 혹은 가까운 행성에서 태어난 아기별일까?
(과학적으로 반박한다)|(친절히 설명한다)

English (United States)(en-US): Actually, Dot, shooting\nstars aren’t really stars.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치, 별똥별은 사실 별이 아니야.

English (United States)(en-US): They're pieces of rock or dust from space\nthat burn through Earth’s atmosphere.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주 티끌이나 먼지가 지구의 대기와의\n마찰로 불타는 현상을 뜻해.

English (United States)(en-US): Shooting stars?\nI hear they’re not actually stars.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별똥별? 그건 별이 아니래.

English (United States)(en-US): They’re bits from space that enter Earth,\nthen burn up and disappear with a wink!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 우주의 티끌이 지구에 들어와,\n반짝 빛을 내며 타오르다 사라지는 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, so they aren’t stars.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별이 아니었구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Did they long to be starlight until the\nvery end,\nonly to die as rock and dust?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 고작 돌과 먼지로서, 그들은 죽는\n순간까지도 별의 빛을 갈망했던 걸까.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh…. They must have. Gazing upon\n their blazing bodies, wretchedly happy.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아…. 분명 그랬겠지. 비참한 만큼\n행복한 채로, 발광하는 몸뚱이를 바라보며.

English (United States)(en-US): And terrified. To have come\ninto this world on their dying breath.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 얼마나 무서웠을까.태어나자마자\n쉰 숨이 그의 마지막 호흡이었다면.

English (United States)(en-US): Help, please help! I’m burning up,\nit hurts, it hurts, it hurts! It hurts!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 살려 줘, 살려 줘! 온몸이 불에 타,\n아파, 아파, 아파! 아파!

English (United States)(en-US): Burnt to a cinder in pure agony,\nbefore fully embracing their fear of death.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 죽음에 대한 공포를 채 끌어안지도 못한 채,\n고통 속에서 타오르다 바스라졌겠지.

English (United States)(en-US): I feel like I know them.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 반가운 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): I wonder why.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 왜일까.

English (United States)(en-US): Maybe because we share some traits.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 비슷한 속성을 가졌거든.

English (United States)(en-US): So I want to gaze at them.\nWarmly. To ease their pain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바라봐 주고 싶어. 따스하게.\n그들이 덜 아플 수 있게.

English (United States)(en-US): You know,\nI heard humans wish on shooting stars.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 있잖아, 인간들은 별똥별에\n소원을 빈다고 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): I have a wish too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나에게도 소원이 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): It glows from miles away.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너무 반짝이고 소중하지만….\n아득한 거리 너머 존재하는.

English (United States)(en-US): And I’m scared I’ll never reach it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 영영 닿을 수 없을까 봐 두려워.

English (United States)(en-US): Will a shooting star make\nmy wish come true?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 별똥별에 빌면 이루어질까?

English (United States)(en-US): I’ve wished on one before.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 별똥별에 소원을 빌어 본 적 있어.|별똥별에 소원을 빌어 본 적은 없어.

English (United States)(en-US): I can’t say for certain that it will,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이루어진다는 것을 확신할 수는 없었지만.

English (United States)(en-US): I couldn’t say for certain that it will,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이루어진다는 것도 확신할 수는 없겠지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But that vague uncertainty\ncan at times be named ‘hope’.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 어렴풋한 불확신은 가끔\n‘희망’이라는 이름으로 불리기도 하니까.

English (United States)(en-US): And that makes all the difference.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그런 대로 반짝이고 소중할 수 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): Do you want to try it with me?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 같이 한번 빌어 볼까?

English (United States)(en-US): Okay.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 빌어 볼래.

English (United States)(en-US): Hold your hands together, and close your eyes.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 두 손을 모으고, 눈을 꼭 감아 봐.

English (United States)(en-US): This is how humans make a wish.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 이렇게 소원을 빌어.
